text: The COVID-19 pandemic first entered South Carolina in March 2020. That same year on April 2 the South Carolina Departments of Health and Environmental Controls announced that the virus was in all the State's forty-six counties. Around 18,200 people were killed by the virus or its complications during the pandemic in the State. ==References== Category:COVID-19 pandemic in the United States Category:2020s in South Carolina
title: COVID-19 pandemic in South Carolina
